course_title: Topics in African American Studies: African American Soundscapes
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0 of 6
class_notes: This course will be altered slightly to expand the geographic site location of the musical and cultural traditions explored. The content and trajectory remain relatively the same with an expansion on the importance and impact of "The Great Migration" and how music, people, and culture. This course will essentially study "The Long Road to Freedom" for African Americans through musical formations, manifestations, and transitions.
course_description: This course explores one of a wide range of topics pertaining to the African American experience in the fields of human and civil rights, the arts, social and literary texts, and the social sciences. May be cross listed with MUS 389R or HIST 362Q when the topic is the same.
sections: Class Nbr: 4395, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: OXF, Meets: TTh 1-2:15p, Instructor: M. McNeill, Status: Wait List
